description:
Student, Research and Development
  Take a central role
  The Bank of Canada has a vision to be a leading central bank—dynamic, engaged and trusted—committed to a better Canada. No other employer in the country offers you the unique opportunity to work at the very center of Canada’s economy, in an organization with significant impact on the economic and financial well-being of all Canadians. You will be challenged, energized and motivated to excel in our environment.
  Building on the principles that have always guided us – excellence, integrity and respect – we strive to be forward-looking and innovative, to welcome people with diverse perspectives and talents, and to earn trust by living up to our commitments and by clearly explaining the intent of our policies and actions.
 
  Find out more about the next steps in our Recruitment process.
 
  Did you know? “Nothing Ventured, Nothing Gained” The Bank of Canada invests in early stage - “Blue Sky” research to develop technologies that Canadians will interact with to keep future banknote designs safe and secure.  What you will do The CUR-PDT team is seeking a four-to-eight month co-op student to assist us in advancing specific projects within our Research and Development (R&D) portfolio. Under the supervision of the R&D Team Lead, the successful candidate will be expected to apply their chemistry/materials science background and an innate sense of curiosity and creativity to:
  
 
   Conduct comprehensive and continual literature research studies to support PDT functions;
   Advance multi-disciplinary R&D efforts that are focused on Building a More Secure Banknote;
   Utilize highly specialized equipment within the Bank to develop proof-of-concept prototypes;
   Initiate novel methodologies that can be used by PDT to evaluate and assess R&D samples from external stakeholders;
   Contribute to other PDT portfolios with effective and timely scientific and technical advice;
   Deliver project updates to the PDT team on a monthly basis;
 
 
  Your education and experience The position requires the completion of three years of an undergraduate program in a field related to chemistry and/or materials science. Students enrolled in a post-graduate (M.Sc./Ph.D.) degree program within these academic disciplines will also be considered. You must be returning to school in the next academic term.  What you need to succeed
 
   You will have experience in applying the scientific method to advance technology-based projects and working in a research and development environment with minimal supervision.
   Stemming from your education, you have well developed problem-solving and analytical skills that are curiosity-driven and results-oriented.
   In addition, you are an excellent communicator (oral/written) and have all of the requisite attributes to manage multiple projects with various internal and external Bank of Canada stakeholders.
   Good inter-personal skills along with the ability to work independently and within a cohesive team-structure are pivotal to the success of this position.
 
   Nice-to-have
 
   With every R&D project, PDT is always looking to assess the potential commercialization of the technology. Any experience with advancing technologies from the Research and Development phase to Pilot-Plant scale would be welcomed by the CUR-PDT team.
 
 
  What you need to know
 
   Language requirement: English or French essential
   Priority will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents
   Security level required: Be eligible to obtain Reliability or Secret
   Critical work must be onsite.
   There will be no relocation assistance provided
   Please save a copy of the job poster. Once the closing date has passed, it will no longer be available.
 
 
  What you can expect from us
  
 
 
   Salary of $27.08 hourly (job grade Student C)
 
 
  We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position. Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.
